security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document contains payroll authorization forms and related memoranda for Leslie H. Wizelman, an employee of the HSCA, including appointment, salary, and termination actions.
summary_one_paragraph: This document consists of payroll authorization forms and memoranda related to Leslie H. Wizelman's employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from July 1977 to December 1978; it includes details of her appointments, salary adjustments, and eventual termination, along with a memo listing her as one of four new research employees and a form regarding relationships to members of Congress. The forms, authorized by Louis Stokes, cover Wizelman's initial appointment as a Researcher at $12,000 per annum, subsequent salary adjustments up to $16,800, and her termination at the close of business on December 31, 1978.
title: Staff Payroll Records
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives
sender: Louis Stokes (Chairman of HSCA, Authorizing Official for payroll actions related to Wizelman)
